definition: to keep one's promise/to mean what one says
to persuade
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
variant of 說|说[shuo1]
dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]
old variant of 話|话[hua4]
to regard as/to figure/to calculate/to compute
to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)
number/figure/several/CL:個|个[ge4]
frequently/repeatedly

sentences.english: We always mean what we say do what we promise.
sentences.chinese: 我们一贯是说话算数的。

sentences.english: You may trust him, he is as good as his word.
sentences.chinese: 你可以相信他，他说话算数。

sentences.english: He certainly means what he said.
You promesed to pay me tomorrow, keep your promise!
sentences.chinese: 你说过明天付款的，你要说话算数。

sentences.english: Who can guarantee that he will keep his word?
I am a man of my word .
OOC Talk is only allowed using Tells.
sentences.chinese: OOC是只允许使用说话算数。

sentences.english: He always keeps to his prom ises.
You promised to pay me today, keep your promise.
sentences.chinese: 你说过今天付款的，你要说话算数。

sentences.english: We always keep to our words.
We Chinese people always mean what we say.
sentences.chinese: 我们中国人从来说话算数。

sentences.english: True to his word, he arrived here on time.
sentences.chinese: 他果然说话算数，按时来了。

sentences.english: I'm serious about this. I mean what I say.
sentences.chinese: 我对此事是认真的，我说话算数。

definition: to do as promised/to be as good as one's word/to honor one's word/to mean what one says
to speak and keep one's promise (idiom); as good as one's word
to be as good as one's word (idiom)/to keep one's promise
promises must be kept
a nobleman's word is his bond (proverb)
pinyin: jun1 zi3 yi1 yan2 , si4 ma3 nan2 zhui1

definition: one word worth nine sacred tripods (idiom); words of enormous weight
lit. to eat one's words/to break a promise/to go back on one's word/to renege/unsworn testimony
(of sb's words) to count/can be trusted
(idiom) it's a deal/that's settled then
lit. once said, a team of horses cannot unsay it (idiom); a promise must be kept
pinyin: yi1 yan2 ji4 chu1 , si4 ma3 nan2 zhui1

definition: a promise worth one thousand in gold (idiom); a promise that must be kept
lit. to grow fat eating one's words (idiom)/fig. not to live up to one's promises
to go back on one's word/to break one's promise/to be unfaithful/to be untrustworthy
let's talk about the unpleasant things first/let's be frank
pinyin: chou3 hua4 shuo1 zai4 qian2 tou5

definition: to count numbers/to keep to one's word/to hold (i.e. to remain valid)/to count (i.e. to be important)
to renege/to go back (on a deal)/to back out (of a promise)
